contents: text | Woodcraft comes naturally to you, and you have learned how to use the forest to your tactical advantage against superior forces in skirmishes against the Molthuni army or the Ironfang Legion.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Dexterity or Wisdom, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Stealth skill and the Forest Lore skill. You gain the Terrain Stalker (underbrush) skill feat.

name: Oenopion Ooze-tender
title: Oenopion Ooze-tender
contents: text | Your apprenticeship in one of Oenopion's unorthodox arcane and alchemical academies instilled in you a deep reservoir of mostly reliable esoteric knowledge, not to mention a deep resentment born of countless hours spent mucking ooze pens and feeding helpless creatures to ravenous, belching jellies and gelatinous puddings.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Constitution or Intelligence, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Crafting skill and the Ooze Lore skill. You gain the Dubious Knowledge skill feat.

name: Onyx Trader
title: Onyx Trader
contents: text | Oprak doesn't share the secrets of the Onyx Vault with many, but you are one of the lucky few to be permitted into the heart of the nation. You have traveled the extradimensional paths of the Stone Roads and traded goods across a wide variety of lands. You've learned to step lively in foreign markets of all types.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Dexterity or Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Society skill and the Mercantile Lore skill. You gain the Multilingual skill feat.

name: Osirionologist
title: Osirionologist
contents: text | Whether you're a fascinated outsider or a local proud of your nation's storied past, you're a devoted student of Osirion's history.
text | You might be a traveling professor, a member of a society like the Pathfinders or the Esoteric Order of the Palatine Eye, or even a simple tomb robber cashing in on the glories of the past.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Constitution or Intelligence, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Occultism skill and the Ancient Osirion Lore skill. You gain the Oddity Identification skill feat.

name: Pathfinder Hopeful
title: Pathfinder Hopeful
contents: text | You've long wanted to join the adventurous Pathfinder Society.
text | You have taken up the dangerous life of an adventurer in hopes of earning a spot among the Pathfinders.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Constitution or Intelligence, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Society skill and the Pathfinder Society Lore skill. You gain the Additional Lore skill feat.

name: Perfection Seeker
title: Perfection Seeker
contents: text | You aspire to perfect your body and mind in the tradition of Jalmeray's Houses of Perfection, honing your acrobatic skills and mental faculties in preparation for a lifetime pushing the edge of what most consider possible.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Dexterity or Wisdom, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Acrobatics skill as well as the Warfare Lore skill. You gain the Cat Fall skill feat.

name: Press-ganged
title: Press-ganged
contents: text | You were forced into service as a sailor against your will.
text | Perhaps you were punished for a crime, were drafted into military service, are repaying a debt, or simply were abducted.
text | Though you were initially trained as a simple deckhand, you may have subsequently studied a trade under one of the vessel's specialists.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Strength or Wisdom, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Society skill and the Sailing Lore skill. You gain the Experienced Professional skill feat.

name: Purveyor Of The Bizarre
title: Purveyor Of The Bizarre
contents: text | Whether in Katapesh or one of the bustling markets along the Path of Salt, you've spent enough time buying and selling ancient or unusual items to give you an instinctive ability to quickly sort valuable trinkets from worthless baubles.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Intelligence or Wisdom, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Arcana skill and the Mercantile Lore skill.
text | You gain the Quick Identification skill feat.

name: Quick
title: Quick
contents: text | Staying alive among the scheming, ravenous undead of Geb required a deep knowledge of their motivations, capabilities, and weaknesses. More often than not, it also required the ability to weave alibis and life-preserving half-truths capable of swaying a stilled heart.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Charisma or Constitution, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Deception skill and the Undead Lore skill.
text | You gain the Charming Liar skill feat.

name: Razmiran Faithful
title: Razmiran Faithful
contents: text | You serve a living god who rules upon the face of Golarion, and this gives your actions a divine mandate not to be trifled with.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Strength or Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Intimidation skill and the Razmir Lore skill. You gain the Group Coercion skill feat.

name: Rivethun Adherent
title: Rivethun Adherent
contents: text | You have spent time learning the practices and traditions of the ancient Rivethun dwarven shamans and can recognize all sorts of magic. You may have chosen your own road since then, or you may remain an adherent of the philosophy.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Constitution or Wisdom, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Occultism skill and the Spirit Lore skill.
text | You gain the Recognize Spell skill feat.

name: Rostland Partisan
title: Rostland Partisan
contents: text | You grew up among the southern houses of Brevoy in old Rostland. You're accustomed to arguing from a position of underappreciated worth.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Constitution or Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Diplomacy skill and the Politics Lore skill.
text | You gain the Group Impression skill feat.

name: Sarkorian Reclaimer
title: Sarkorian Reclaimer
contents: text | Whether you trace your heritage to lost Sarkoris or are a crusader trying to atone for past fanatics' wrongs, you seek to liberate the Sarkorian homeland from the demons who have defiled it.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Constitution or Wisdom, and one is a free boost.
text | You're trained in the Medicine skill and the Abyssal Lore skill.
text | You gain the Battle Medicine skill feat.

name: Sarkorian Survivor
title: Sarkorian Survivor
contents: text | The devastation and carnage of the Worldwound were nearly complete, but you somehow managed to survive it.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Strength or Constitution, and one is a free boost.
text | You're trained in the Survival skill and the Sarkorian History Lore skill. You gain the Forager skill feat.

name: Scholar Of The Ancients
title: Scholar Of The Ancients
contents: text | You're fascinated by the lost Azlanti Empire and have dedicated yourself to seeking out and studying every broken artifact or scrap of knowledge that remains, whether as an academic pursuit or simply for the joy of treasure hunting.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Intelligence or Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Arcana skill and the Azlant Lore skills. You gain the Quick Identification skill feat.

name: Secular Medic
title: Secular Medic
contents: text | You're from Rahadoum, where the Laws of Mortality taught you to reject the gods, yet you've seen firsthand how dangerous it can be to go without healing magic. As a result, you've thrown yourself into the study of medicine, so you can save lives without saving souls.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Wisdom or Dexterity, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Medicine skill and the Anatomy Lore skill.
text | You gain the Battle Medicine skill feat.

name: Senghor Sailor
title: Senghor Sailor
contents: text | As an experienced sailor from Senghor, you know that the only thing saving you from disaster on the high seas is a properly maintained ship. You know boat-building inside and out and you can quickly cobble together a solution in the event that something breaks.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Intelligence or Wisdom, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Crafting skill and the Sailing Lore skill. You gain the Quick Repair skill feat.

name: Shadow Haunted
title: Shadow Haunted
contents: text | You are from Nidal, and regardless of your personal values, Zon-Kuthon has a claim on your soul due to an ancient pact. The Midnight Lord's unsettling influence is bred deep into your bones.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Intelligence or Wisdom, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Intimidation skill and the Shadow Plane Lore skill. You gain the Quick Coercion skill feat.

name: Shoanti Name-bearer
title: Shoanti Name-bearer
contents: text | You are a member of a Shoanti quah and have gone through its coming of age ceremony, gaining the traditional tattoo of your quah and earning your adult name.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Strength or Wisdom, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Athletics skill and the Quah Lore skill. You gain the Combat Climber skill feat.

name: Shory Seeker
title: Shory Seeker
contents: text | You've dedicated your life to unraveling the secrets of the ancient Shory Empire, either through meticulous research or by traveling into dangerous and distant ruins to track down longlost artifacts.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Dexterity or Intelligence, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Crafting skill and the Shory Lore skill. You gain the Specialty Crafting skill feat.

name: Sodden Scavenger
title: Sodden Scavenger
contents: text | You've managed to eke out an existence in the storm-wracked Sodden Lands and have become an expert at scavenging food and tools.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Constitution or Wisdom, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Survival skill and the Swamp Lore skill.
text | You gain the Forager skill feat.

name: Storm Survivor
title: Storm Survivor
contents: text | Through luck or through skill, you managed to survive a catastrophic maritime disaster, such as a shipwreck or being thrown overboard. You have a keen sense for weather or situations that are similar to the one you escaped.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Strength or Wisdom, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Survival skill and the Weather Lore skill.
text | You gain the Forager skill feat.

name: Taldan Schemer
title: Taldan Schemer
contents: text | Whether willing or unwilling, you have been involved in the many cutthroat political intrigues within Taldor. You might have been born into it as a member of the aristocracy, or you might have taken an active role in the recent events of the War for the Crown.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Charisma or Constitution, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Diplomacy skill and the Politics Lore skill. You gain the Hobnobber skill feat.

name: Thassilonian Traveler
title: Thassilonian Traveler
contents: text | You come from ancient Thassilon, one of the citizens that appeared out of time alongside the city of Xin-Edasseril. You know many things that have been long forgotten... along with many things that are no longer correct.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Constitution or Intelligence, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Arcana skill and the Thassilon Lore skill.
text | You gain the Dubious Knowledge skill feat.

name: Thrune Loyalist
title: Thrune Loyalist
contents: text | Despite the setbacks Cheliax has suffered recently, your loyalties lie with the devil-backed House Thrune. You consider the current queen to be the rightful ruler of your homeland, and you are willing to act against her enemies.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Intelligence or Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Religion skill and the Hell Lore skill You gain the Student of the Canon skill feat.

name: Thuvian Unifier
title: Thuvian Unifier
contents: text | You believe the city-states of Thuvia should be united into one nation under the rule of your home city (most commonly Aspenthar), and you're willing to do whatever it takes to make it happen.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Strength or Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Intimidation skill and the Politics Lore skill. You gain the Quick Coercion skill feat.

name: Trade Consortium Underling
title: Trade Consortium Underling
contents: text | Your experience as a ledger-keeper for one of Absalom's trade guilds has made you a canny investor and shrewd entrepreneur.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Intelligence or Wisdom, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Society skill and the Business Lore skill.
text | You gain the Experienced Professional skill feat.

name: Ulfen Raider
title: Ulfen Raider
contents: text | You are an Ulfen warrior, feared among Avistan for the merciless and devastating raids your people once conducted along the shores. Though the days of these Ulfen raids are largely past, you have been trained to strike terror into the hearts of those who face you.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Strength or Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Intimidation skill and the Sailing Lore skill.
text | You gain the Intimidating Glare skill feat.

name: Undersea Enthusiast
title: Undersea Enthusiast
contents: text | You love diving and exploring the world beneath the waves, and long periods of swimming have trained you to move easily through the water. You're also fascinated by undersea creatures and cultures—and may even have a trace of one of them in your own lineage.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Strength or Constitution, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Athletics skill and the Ocean Lore skill.
text | You gain the Underwater Marauder skill feat.

name: Ustalavic Academic
title: Ustalavic Academic
contents: text | You were educated at a famed Ustalavic academy, such as the University of Lepidstadt or the Sincomakti School of Sciences, and received quality instruction in advanced concepts of mathematics, science, and engineering.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Intelligence or Wisdom, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Crafting skill and the Academia Lore skill. You gain the Skill Training skill feat.

name: Varisian Wanderer
title: Varisian Wanderer
contents: text | You have spent your youth wandering the lands of Varisia and beyond among the brightly painted wagons of a Varisian caravan. You have heard endless tales of your people's history and lore, and have learned many songs and stories from the disparate people you have met.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Dexterity or Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Performance skill and the Circus Lore skill. You gain the Fascinating Performance skill feat.

name: Vidrian Reformer
title: Vidrian Reformer
contents: text | You know that the only way your homeland of Vidrian can remain free from outside conquerors is by forging a strong and unified government. As such, you seek to bind your fellow citizens together through careful diplomacy and force of personality—or, if necessary, subterfuge and intrigue.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Dexterity or Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Diplomacy skill and the Politics Lore skill.
text | You gain the Hobnobber skill feat.

name: Whispering Way Scion
title: Whispering Way Scion
contents: text | Your family has long been associated with the enigmatic death cult known as the Whispering Way, which was recently responsible for the terrible devastation in the nation of Lastwall. Whether or not you have followed in their footsteps, you know many of the philosophy's secrets.
text | Choose two ability boosts.
text | One must be to Intelligence or Wisdom, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Religion skill and the Undead Lore skill. You gain the Student of the Canon skill feat.

name: Wildwood Local
title: Wildwood Local
contents: text | You might have been born and raised among the druids of the Verduran Forest, or you may have spent time among them as an adult and come to know their ways.
text | Choose two ability boosts.
text | One must be to Dexterity or Wisdom, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Nature skill as well as the Forest Lore skill. You gain the Natural Medicine skill feat.

name: Winter's Child
title: Winter's Child
contents: text | Your or one of your ancestors hails from Irrisen, and some spark of the icy region's magic has manifested itself within your bones. The blood of Baba Yaga's legacy runs in your veins, and you are at one with the mysteries and dangers of the frozen land.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Constitution or Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Arcana skill and the Weather Lore skill. You gain the Arcane Sense skill feat.

name: Witch Wary
title: Witch Wary
contents: text | You have little love or trust for spellcraft and those who practice it, and have developed a paranoid knack for recognizing such tricks. You are constantly on guard for the magic of witches and have been trained to spot the signs of those with minds affected by magic.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Dexterity or Intelligence, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Occultism skill and the Curse Lore skill. You gain the Oddity Identification skill feat.

name: Wonder Taster
title: Wonder Taster
contents: text | Having once sampled Numerian fluids, you've tasted knowledge beyond comprehension. You are driven to recapture that astounding experience.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Intelligence or Constitution, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Crafting skill and the Alchemical Lore skill. You gain the Alchemical Crafting skill feat.

name: Academy Dropout
title: Academy Dropout
contents: text | You were enrolled at a prestigious magical academy, but you've since dropped out. Maybe there was a momentous incident, maybe you had to return to other responsibilities, or perhaps it was just too much for you. Whatever the case, your exit from the academy has shaped your life as much as your entrance and led you to a life of adventure.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Intelligence or Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in Arcana and Academia Lore. You gain the Dubious Knowledge skill feat.

name: Anti-magical
title: Anti-magical
contents: text | Magic has never worked quite right around you. Perhaps you have become a magic-user in spite of that, or perhaps you use your unique ability to fight magic-users.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Constitution or Wisdom, and one is a free ability boost.

text | You're trained in a Lore skill of your choice, though it can't be about a magical subject (as determined by the GM if it's unclear). Whenever you would be affected by magic, even your own magic or that of an ally, the originator of the effect must attempt a DC 3 flat check.

text | On a failure, the magic doesn't affect you (though it still has its normal effects on anyone else). On a success, the magic affects you and there is no need to attempt further flat checks for the same magical effect, even if it affects you again later.

name: Astrologer
title: Astrologer
contents: text | Astrologers look to the stars for signs and portents, using their positions to chart courses for those living beneath them. As the celestial spheres move, so does fate itself. You studied the stars and learned to divine your path based on their guidance. Whether the stars directly called you to a life of adventure or you use the stars to guide your wanderlust, you're living out the stars' guidance in a life of adventure.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Intelligence or Wisdom, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in Occultism and Astrology Lore. You gain the Oddity Identification skill feat.

name: Chosen One
title: Chosen One
contents: text | Your birth has fulfilled a prediction, and people close to you are counting on you to do great things. There's intense pressure on you to be up to the task, and the fickle nature of prophecy complicates your path.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Strength or Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.

text | Decide with your GM the basics of the prophecy in which you're meant to play a major part. You're trained in one skill related to the prophecy, and the Fortune-Telling Lore skill. You gain the Prophecy's Pawn free action.
fill
section | Prophecy's Pawn [[free-action]]| *Trigger* You fail a saving throw, attack roll, or skill check
text | You twist the prophecy in your favor, which will have consequences later. Reroll the failed check. You must use the result of the second roll.
text | For 24 hours afterward, the GM can force you to reroll a successful saving throw, attack roll, or skill check as fate balances the scale.
text | This is a misfortune effect. You can't use prophecy's pawn again until the GM uses this option or 24 hours pass, whichever comes first.
rule
fill

name: Eidolon Contact
title: Eidolon Contact
contents: text | You've come into contact with a disembodied being of magical essence known as an eidolon.

text | You might have forged a powerful conduit with that eidolon, allowing you to manifest it as a summoner, but it's much more likely that you lost contact over time, though not before learning a few half-remembered secrets. If you lost contact, you might have become an adventurer to try to reach the eidolon again, or to be sure that you're rid of it forever.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Constitution or Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.

text | You're trained in your choice of Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion, and a Lore skill for the creature associated with your contacted eidolon (such as Angel Lore or Dragon Lore). You gain the Dubious Knowledge skill feat.

name: Energy Scarred
title: Energy Scarred
contents: text | Exposure to a significant magical event overloaded you with magical energy. Perhaps you were exposed to dangerous levels of magical energy that left you near death, or it built up over long-term exposure to a powerful source of magic.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be Constitution and one is a free ability boost.

text | Your innate magical trait is primal. Choose acid, cold, electricity, fire, force, negative, positive, or sonic. You are trained in a Lore skill associated with the chosen energy (such as Fire Lore) and you gain resistance to that energy type equal to half your level (minimum 1).

name: False Medium
title: False Medium
contents: text | There are people in this world who possess the ability to pierce the veil between the world of the living and the world of the dead, allowing them to communicate with spirits. You... are not one of them. But you know enough about the occult, as well as cold reading tricks and various practices from local religions, to scam your way into people's coinpurses. Unlike a through-and-through charlatan, there's some real occult methodology behind your flimflam, but that's likely cold comfort to the people you swindle.

text | Whether you decided to take a more righteous path, were caught and pledged to make it right, or still slip in a few "séances" between adventures, you've taken to an adventuring lifestyle as you move from place to place.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Intelligence or Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in Occultism and Fortune-Telling Lore.
text | You gain the Deceptive Worship skill feat.

name: Genie-blessed
title: Genie-blessed
contents: text | You've sought out a powerful genie and requested their blessing, hoping to increase your fortune. Your wish was vague, but fortune and the genie favored you with a more powerful effect than an ordinary wish, granting you bits of wish-twisted luck throughout the rest of your life.
text | Meanwhile, other genies of the same kind recognize you as one blessed by one of their most powerful nobles, and might treat you with greater respect or envy.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Diplomacy skill and the Genie Lore skill. You gain the Wish for Luck free action.
fill
section | Wish for Luck [[free-action]]| *Trigger* You are about to roll an attack roll, saving throw, or skill check
text | You wish aloud for success. Roll the check twice and take the higher result.
rule
fill

name: Magical Experiment
title: Magical Experiment
contents: text | At some point in your life, powerful people performed magical experiments on you that changed you permanently.
text | You may have signed up for this voluntarily, but it may have been against your will. You still bear the marks, as well as the abilities.
text | You gain one ability boost. It must be to Constitution.
text | You're trained in Occultism and the Academia Lore skill.
text | You gain one special ability as a result of the magical experimentation. Work with the GM to select an appropriate ability from the following list or to come up with another special ability.

bullet | **Enhanced Senses** You gain low-light vision (or darkvision if you already had low-light vision) and an imprecise sense with a range of 30 feet, such as scent, thoughtsense, tremorsense, or wavesense.

bullet | **Resistant Skin** The experiments rendered your skin tougher and resilient to a particular type of damage. You gain resistance equal to half your level (minimum resistance 1) against two of the following types of energy damage, one chosen by you and the other chosen by the GM: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic.

bullet | **Touch Telepathy** The experiments to your body allowed you to link minds via touch. You gain telepathy with creatures as long as you are in physical contact. This allows you to communicate mentally with any creatures you're in physical contact with, as long as you both share a language. This doesn't give any special access to their thoughts, and communicates no more information than normal speech would.

name: Magical Merchant
title: Magical Merchant
contents: text | Selling magic items isn't like being an ordinary merchant. The wares you buy and sell are expensive, making each sale rare and lucrative. You've developed knowledge of expert handiwork to ensure you don't fall for a scam, since buying a single counterfeit item can lead to bankruptcy. Whether you went out of business and had to find alternative employment, or took up adventuring to acquire new merchandise, you've taken to adventuring yourself.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Intelligence or Wisdom, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in Crafting and Mercantile Lore. You gain the Crafter's Appraisal skill feat.

name: Magical Misfit
title: Magical Misfit
contents: text | You don't understand folks who claim that magical talent is some sort of burden or great responsibility; you've always used your magic to cause trouble and to escape the consequences. Whether becoming an adventurer is your attempt to make amends or just a new way to make some mischief, you're excited to see where it takes you, and you still delight in using your skills to get out of trouble.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Intelligence or Dexterity, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in Arcana and Underworld Lore. You gain the Trick Magic Item skill feat.

name: Musical Prodigy
title: Musical Prodigy
contents: text | Ever since you were young, you've been almost supernaturally skilled in a particular type of music. The people around you were sure you'd grow up to perform at royal courts or to become a world-famous composer, but you've chosen a life of adventure instead. You might have given up on those dreams to find your own meaning, or you might find that adventuring allows you to experience unfiltered emotions and exploits that you can translate into a wondrous symphony some day.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Dexterity or Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in Performance and Music Lore. You gain the Virtuosic Performer skill feat.

name: Mystic Tutor
title: Mystic Tutor
contents: text | You spent years predicting, identifying, and harnessing the innate magical talents of those around you. A magic-rich world has taught you that you can never have too much training when everyone around you is capable of magic.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be Intelligence or Wisdom and one is a free ability boost.

text | Your innate magical trait is arcane or occult. You're trained in either Arcana or Occultism, depending on your innate magical trait, and the Academia Lore skill. You gain the Recognize Spell skill feat.

name: Occult Librarian
title: Occult Librarian
contents: text | Hours spent reading numerous compendiums dedicated to various occult topics honed your knowledge of these more obscure magical arts. You might have taken to adventuring to finance your acquisition of rare tomes, to explore occult mysteries that can't be found in the pages of a book, or perhaps to put your skills to the test.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Intelligence or Wisdom, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Occultism skill and the Academia Lore skill. You gain the Schooled in Secrets skill feat.

name: Plant Whisperer
title: Plant Whisperer
contents: text | You've always had a green thumb, allowing you to care for plants that others found too difficult to grow and tend with a skill that borders on the magical. As you travel, you encounter all sorts of new plants and plant creatures, allowing you to expand your horizons and deepen your understanding of flora.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Wisdom or Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in Nature and Plant Lore. You gain the Natural Medicine skill feat.

name: Seer Of The Dead
title: Seer Of The Dead
contents: text | You have long been gifted with the ability to see and speak with the departed. This could have manifested at your birth or when a chance encounter linked you inextricably to the spirits of the dead. Their constant presence might feel like a curse, or it might provide you with welcome companionship.
text | You gain one ability boost. It must be to Constitution or Wisdom.
text | You're trained in Religion and Undead Lore. You gain the effects of the spirit sense spell at all times.

name: Song Of The Deep
title: Song Of The Deep
contents: text | During a sea voyage, you washed overboard, ingested sea water, and drowned. Merfolk, kelpies, sea serpents, or another magical denizen of the sea pulled your unconscious body from the briny depths. Having spent so much time underwater, your lungs were filled with salt water. To restore your ability to breathe, they exhaled into your lungs and shared the ability to breathe underwater in the process. You came back with the ability to breathe water, as well as a newfound knowledge of your time beneath the waves.
text | You gain one ability boost. It must be to Strength, Constitution, or Charisma.
text | You're trained in the Athletics skill and the Ocean Lore skill. You have the ability to breathe underwater.

text | **Special** You can choose to lose the ability to breathe air when you take this background, making you only able to breathe underwater. If you do, you gain a second ability boost, which is a free ability boost.

name: Street Preacher
title: Street Preacher
contents: text | Forget the church orthodoxy and the stuffy cloisters— spreading the word of your god to the people is your calling. You've preached on the street corners and in public houses, to wanderers on the road and to captives in the stocks. Adventuring can take you across the world. What vocation could better serve to take your holy words to fresh ears?
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Wisdom or Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in the Religion skill and the Lore skill for your patron deity. You gain the Dubious Knowledge skill feat.

name: Student Of Magic
title: Student Of Magic
contents: text | You are currently enrolled at a school of magic, where you're learning the fundamentals of your magical tradition. Whether your adventuring occurs during breaks between semesters, as part of a work study program, or even within the halls of the academy itself, you'll have to learn to juggle your dual life.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Intelligence or Wisdom, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in your choice of Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion, as well as Academia Lore. You gain the Recognize Spell skill feat.

name: Surge Investigator
title: Surge Investigator
contents: text | From rivers that charm all who come near to forests that speak through dream messages, you have seen and studied many kinds of magical terrain. The world is so rich in magic that it can affect the land itself, and you have traveled extensively to learn the ways of identifying the oddities of magical terrain wherever it arises.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be Constitution or Wisdom and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in your choice of Nature or Occultism and the Magical Terrain Lore skill. You gain the Terrain Expertise skill feat.

name: Time Traveler
title: Time Traveler
contents: text | You come from a different time. Whether by your own doing or a terrible accident, powerful magic has resulted in you coming to this time from the future or from the past, but you are unable to return. You might be from New Thassilon, an entire nation of time travelers.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Dexterity or Intelligence, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You are trained in three Lore skills of your choice that represent your knowledge from your old time. You gain the Bend Time reaction.
fill
section | Bend Time [[free-action]]| *Trigger* Your turn begins
text | You are quickened this turn. You can use your extra action to Stride.
rule
fill

name: Sponsored By A Stranger
title: Sponsored By A Stranger
contents: text | You remember the day the stranger approached you to make several peculiar inquiries. You don't remember much about them, other than a large head and a frail body. At first, the stranger's questions seemed odd: how might forgotten history nevertheless shape the present, whether an insect hive mind could be manipulated at a distance, and so on. You don't remember all of the questions, and you don't know why you could refuse to answer some but felt compelled to answer others. The stranger nevertheless seemed pleased with your responses and insisted you would find study at the Magaambya enlightening. You never saw them again, but you're now here at the Magaambya, with more questions than answers about your future.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Intelligence or Wisdom, and one is a free ability boost.
text | You're trained in your choice of the Occultism or Nature skill. You gain your choice of the Dubious Knowledge or Quick Identification skill feat. You're also trained in Insect Lore.
text | Your recommended primary branch is the Rain-Scribes.

name: Sponsored By A Village
title: Sponsored By A Village
contents: text | You come from a small community far from any large cities, but the Magaambya is known even in your isolated corner of the world. You have shown more scholarly talent than anyone from your village in many years, perhaps even generations, and the village elders have insisted you explore your potential at the Magaambya. Whether you were eager to leave or not seemed irrelevant to the elders; you had the talent, so you must go. You don't know how the elders had the connections or influence to sponsor your education there, but you've left your tightknit community behind for the city of Nantambu and the Magaambya at its heart.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Intelligence or Wisdom, and one is a free ability boost.

text | You're trained in your choice of the Crafting or Survival skill. You gain a skill feat: Crafter's Appraisal if you chose Crafting or Forager if you chose Survival. You're also trained in the Mafika Ayuwari Lore skill appropriate for the terrain around your community (such as Forest Lore or Jungle Lore)
text | Your recommended primary branch is the Cascade Bearers.

name: Sponsored By Family
title: Sponsored By Family
contents: text | Several members of your family have studied at the Magaambya, although not all of them have graduated as lore-speakers (or even advanced past initiates to become attendants). Your family has decided that you're an excellent candidate to join their ranks. Although lore-speakers of the Magaambya know they are supported by the strength of thousands of graduates who have come before them, you can take the smaller, more personal comfort in the support of your family.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Intelligence or Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.

text | You're trained in your choice of the Diplomacy or Society skill. You gain a skill feat: Hobnobber if you chose Diplomacy or Eye for Numbers if you chose Society. You're also trained in Magaambya Lore.
text | Your recommended primary branch is the Uzunjati.

name: Sponsored By Teacher Ot
title: Sponsored By Teacher Ot
contents: text | You have known the Magaambyan teacher Takulu Ot and his wife Niana for many years. Both are amateur bird-watchers and musicians, and you share one of these hobbies. They are pleasant people and well-regarded in Nantambu, although their unshakable generosity and friendliness strike cynics as too earnest to be genuine.
text | You know otherwise; Takulu and Niana are just as sincere as they appear.
text | Takulu always seemed to watch you with a discerning eye, and one day he idly observed that you'd do well at the Magaambya.

text | Talking about it further with him, Takulu agreed that he would sponsor you personally and be the one to give your intake interview. With a twinkle in his eye, he asked that you call him Teacher Ot from now on, just as all of his students do.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Wisdom or Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.

text | You're trained in your choice of the Survival or Performance skill. You gain a skill feat: Survey Wildlife if you chose Survival or Impressive Performance if you chose Performance. You're also trained in Nantambu Lore.
text | Your recommended primary branch is the Emerald Boughs.

name: Unsponsored
title: Unsponsored
contents: text | You have aspirations of attending the Magaambya academy of magic, but fate seemed to thwart you at every turn. You were unable to obtain a sponsorship and lost a collection of helpful textbooks to unexpected insect damage. You nevertheless made the long trip to Nantambu through terrible weather, uncharacteristically bad roads, and indifferent fellow travelers. Yet you have persevered. Now that you are here, alone but determined, you won't let anything stand in your way.
text | Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Constitution or Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.

text | You're trained in your choice of the Diplomacy or Intimidation skill. You gain a skill feat: Group Impression if you chose Diplomacy or Intimidating Glare if you chose Intimidation. You're also trained in Academia Lore.
text | Your recommended primary branch is the Tempest-Sun Mages.
